titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

bioghist.p: Emir Rodriguez Monegal (1921-1985) was a literary critic, an editor of Latin American literature, and a professor at Yale University since 1969. Especially with his editorial guidance of Mundo Nuevo, he was a part of the mid 20th century boom in Spanish American literature that led to many Latin American writers being published outside of their home countries and gaining critical recognition. He wrote key books about Jorge Luis Borges and Pablo Neruda.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of the personal and professional papers of Emir Rodriguez Monegal. Materials include manuscripts and research notes for Rodriquez Monegal's books and articles; documents from his work at Mundo Nuevo, including copies of the journal, clippings, correspondence, and manuscripts; correspondence with authors, scholars, and critics; lecture notes; diaries and personal correspondence; photographs; and clippings.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

otherfindaid.p: An inventory is available in the repository.
A paper finding aid is available in the repository.

relatedmaterial.p: Related material may be found in the following collections: Manuscripts and Archives, Yale University: Emir Rodriguez Monegal papers; Department of Rare Books and Special Collections, Princeton University: Emir Rodriguez Monegal papers.
